alert.note: Alert for East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 9:28PM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... Cold, unstable air will continue to move in from the ocean tonight and Monday morning resulting in light snow accumulations ranging from a light dusting to 2 to 4 inches mainly above 1500 feet tonight and Monday morning. In the North Bay mountains snow accumulations may near 5 to 7 inches tonight and Monday morning. Snow and ice on roadways that traverse Bay Area passes may become disrupted during the Monday morning commute. If planning travel across the higher elevations and passes in the Bay Area late tonight and Monday morning, please allow extra time to safely reach your destinations. Any lingering accumulating snow will end by late Monday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow accumulations ranging from a light dusting to 2 to 4 inches for elevations above 1500 ft to locally 4 to 6 inches at and above 2500 ft. * WHERE...Expect light snow accumulations above 1500 feet, with highest accumulations at or above 2500 feet. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Slick, snow-covered roads and hiking trails. Snow and ice on roadways has the potential to disrupt the Monday morning commute, including over the Highway 17 summit. If planning travel across higher elevations and passes in the Bay Area late tonight and Monday morning, please allow extra time to safely reach your destinations. Heavier snow showers could produce limited visibilities. Downed trees and power outages possible. Any lingering accumulating snow will end by late Monday morning.

area.areaDesc: East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills; Santa Cruz Mountains
